0: CLOSE A gunman injured a teen and shot a man in a pair of carjacking attempts Sunday, before being killed by a bystander outside a Washington state Walmart store. Police say a bystander killed the gunman. (June 18) AP NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Walmart is debuting a new personal shopping experience in New York City called Jetblack. (Photo: SAUL LOEB, AFP/Getty Images) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR An armed civilian is credited with saving several lives when he stopped a man firing shots at a Walmart in Washington Sunday. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The Tumwater Police Department identified the deceased gunman Monday as Tim O. Day, 44, of McCleary, Wash. He shot two people and tried carjacking six people. Day also fired shots inside the Walmart, but did not hit anyone inside the store. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR A man who would rather not be identified stopped the crime spree when he shot and killed Day. Police say the 47-year-old man is from Oakville, Washington. He is a pastor, volunteer firefighter, and medic. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR One of the people Day shot remains in critical condition at Harborview Medical Center in Seattle. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The other, 16-year-old Danner Barton, got shot in the hand by Day after Barton refused to stop his car. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “I ducked my head and I gunned it,” said Barton, who said Day fired a shot through Barton’s windshield. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR More: Mom of school shooting hero says she 'would hug' the shooter's parents NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR More: What the Waffle House hero James Shaw Jr. plans to do with $229K GoFundMe donations NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The bullet lodged in Barton’s steering wheel and hit his hand. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “My thumb hurts really bad, actually,” said Barton, who was grateful someone stopped Day. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “Without him how many lives could (Day) have taken?" asked Barton, "So super-thankful for that hero." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The incident started around 5 p.m. when police were called to a report of a possible carjacking near a gas station. Day approached a family and tried to take their car but was unsuccessful. He fled the scene, driving the wrong way down the highway and entered the city of Tumwater where he crashed his vehicle. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR He left his car and attempted to carjack at least two other vehicles, fired shots and demanded the owners abandon their cars. The suspect successfully carjacked a third vehicle that he drove to Walmart, according to police. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR More: Oklahoma restaurant shooter had license as armed guard; attack stopped by 2 armed men NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Dayentered the Walmart store around 5:30 p.m., fired shots at an ammunition display case and removed some ammunition. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Two shoppers in the store were legally carrying firearms and heard the shots. The armed civilians followed him to the parking lot where he shot a man while attempting to take his car. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Day approached a second car, and when the driver backed away, one of the armed citizens shot him. After shooting Day, the civilian immediately retrieved his first aid kit from his car and rendered aid to the victim of the attempted carjacking until help arrived. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "He is a hero. This (suspect) could have taken out more people, wounded or killed," witness Brian Adams said. "(The suspect) hijacks a car apparently to get here, then hijacks another car. If this customer hadn't done what he did.... Yeah, he's a hero." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Witness to Tumwater Walmart shooting says bystander that shot and killed suspect is a hero. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Says that man also rendered aid to victim that was shot. @KING5Seattlepic.twitter.com/Jud3YCtV7a — Michael Crowe (@MichaelReports) June 18, 2018 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The victim was later airlifted to Harborview. He remains listed in critical condition. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "All of a sudden, you hear this pop or a crash sound. About 15 to 20 seconds, maybe even later, another sound exactly the same," witness John Gerasimczyk said. "I saw everyone else started to exit the area. Some people were moving more slowly, they were still kinda confused what was going on, so I just started shouting, 'go, go, go!'" NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR More: Parkland survivor celebrate shrapnel-free face, meets hero with fellow student-survivor friends NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Investigators say the vehicle stolen during the earlier carjacking was recovered in the Walmart parking lot. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Investigators say Day has a history of drug and weapons crimes and believe he was high and suffering from mental health issues Sunday. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Police are not looking for any other suspects.
